content.question: ​The life expectancy for a human in the United States can be modeled by the function <math alttext="L"><semantics><mi>L</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> given by <math alttext="L open parentheses x close parentheses equals 42.53 plus 13.86 ln x"><semantics><mrow><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>42.53</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>13.86</mn><mi>ln</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. <math alttext="L open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> gives the life expectancy, in years, for <math alttext="x"><semantics><mi>x</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> decades after the year 1900. Based on the model, when is the first time that human life expectancy is predicted to be <math alttext="80"><semantics><mn>80</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> years? (Note: <math alttext="1"><semantics><mn>1</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> decade is <math alttext="10"><semantics><mn>10</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> years).

topic.text: 2.14: Logarithmic Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
